required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Assess the Incidence Rate of the Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (MACE) and Safety of Fenofibrate (Lipilfen Capsule)
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center, Prospective, Observational Study to Assess the Incidence Rate of the Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (MACE) and Safety of Fenofibrate (Lipilfen Capsule) Add-on to Statin Therapy in Patients Who Have History of Acute Myocardial Infarction and Are Diagnosed With Metabolic Syndrome

oversight_info.authority: Korea: Ministry of Food and Drug Safety

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the incidence rate of the major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) and safety of fenofibrate (Lipilfen capsule) add-on statin therapy in patients who have history of acute myocardial infarction and are diagnosed with metabolic syndrome.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence rate of the major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE)

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence rate of the major adverse cardiac and cerebrovascular event (MACCE)
secondary_outcome.description: non-cardiac death, stroke, hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome

study_pop.textblock: Subjects aged more than 20 with history of acute myocardial infarction and diagnosed with metabolic syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients >20 years of age.
- history of acute myocardial infarction
- metabolic syndrome diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- current liver disease or AST or ALT greater than 3 times the upper limit of reference range
- pre-existing gallbladder disease
- moderate to severe renal disorder (serum creatinine >2.5mg/dL)
- pancreatitis diagnosis
